nl.esciencecenter.xenon.files

Interface FileAttributes


  • public interface FileAttributes
    FileAttributes represents a set of attributes of a path.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Niels Drost , Jason Maassen

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long creationTime()
      Get the creation time for this file.
      String group()
      Get the group of this file.
      boolean isDirectory()
      Does the path refer to a directory ?
      boolean isExecutable()
      Does the path refer to an executable file ?
      boolean isHidden()
      Does the path refer to an hidden file ?
      boolean isOther()
      Is the path not a file, link or directory ?
      boolean isReadable()
      Does the path refer to an readable file ?
      boolean isRegularFile()
      Does the path refer to a regular file ?
      boolean isSymbolicLink()
      Does the path refer to a symbolic link ?
      boolean isWritable()
      Does the path refer to a writable file ?
      long lastAccessTime()
      Get the last access time for this file.
      long lastModifiedTime()
      Get the last modified time for this file.
      String owner()
      Get the owner of this file.
      Set<PosixFilePermission> permissions()
      Get the permissions of this file.
      long size()
      Get the size of this file.

    • Method Detail

      • isDirectory

        boolean isDirectory()
        Does the path refer to a directory ?

      • isOther

        boolean isOther()
        Is the path not a file, link or directory ?
        Returns:
        If the file is a directory.

      • isRegularFile

        boolean isRegularFile()
        Does the path refer to a regular file ?
        Returns:
        If the path refers to a regular file.

      • isSymbolicLink

        boolean isSymbolicLink()
        Does the path refer to a symbolic link ?
        Returns:
        If the path refers to a symbolic link.

      • creationTime

        long creationTime()
        Get the creation time for this file. If creationTime is not supported by the adaptor, the lastModifiedTime() will be returned instead.
        Returns:
        The creation time for this file.

      • lastAccessTime

        long lastAccessTime()
        Get the last access time for this file. If lastAccessTime is not supported by the adaptor, the lastModifiedTime() will be returned instead.
        Returns:
        The last access time for this file.

      • lastModifiedTime

        long lastModifiedTime()
        Get the last modified time for this file. If lastModifiedTime is not supported by the adaptor, 0 will be returned instead.
        Returns:
        The last modified time for this file.

      • size

        long size()
        Get the size of this file. If the file is not a regular file, 0 will be returned.
        Returns:
        The size of this file.

      • isExecutable

        boolean isExecutable()
        Does the path refer to an executable file ?
        Returns:
        If the path refers an executable file ?

      • isHidden

        boolean isHidden()
        Does the path refer to an hidden file ?
        Returns:
        If the path refers an hidden file ?

      • isReadable

        boolean isReadable()
        Does the path refer to an readable file ?
        Returns:
        If the path refers an readable file ?

      • isWritable

        boolean isWritable()
        Does the path refer to a writable file ?
        Returns:
        If the path refers a writable file ?

      • group

        String group()
             throws AttributeNotSupportedException
        Get the group of this file.
        Returns:
        The group of this file.
        Throws:
        AttributeNotSupportedException - If the attribute is not supported by the adaptor.

      • owner

        String owner()
             throws AttributeNotSupportedException
        Get the owner of this file.
        Returns:
        The owner of this file.
        Throws:
        AttributeNotSupportedException - If the attribute is not supported by the adaptor.

      • permissions

        Set<PosixFilePermission> permissions()
                                     throws AttributeNotSupportedException
        Get the permissions of this file.
        Returns:
        The permissions of this file.
        Throws:
        AttributeNotSupportedException - If the attribute is not supported by the adaptor.
